title: Tanks will never be able to have individual power curves as long as %Pen items exist
body:
With the vanguard update coming soon people are saying how tanks should have individual power curves within just like every other class does

But this will never be achievable as long as Last Whisper Items/Void staff exist. Their existence means all tanks suck ass late game by design, so they need to be compensated elsewhere. This is why tanks early/mid games are so absurd because their resists are jacked up to compensate for void staff/LW but this means normal champions can't really kill them ever. 

Until we address this there will never be diversity among tank scaling

Things that need to happen: 
Remove %Pen items
Nerf all armor/mr items by 25% or so

No, you'd see protect the carry comps again.  We've seen this before back when Trist, Kog and Vayne where meta about 4-5 years ago.  It's better to have an enchanter for AoE utility buffs, and some form of ranged carry, either for teamfighting or sieging/pushing, than a fourth and fifth tank due to sort of inherent diminishing returns of role stacking-- at a certain point you start getting less and less out of each additional point of EHP your team collectively has at the cost of damage and utility you could have potentially had instead.  The Most Effective TActic is always an attempt to optimize those values of damage, durability and uttility.  At no point has one of those aspects completely eclipsed the other, though lately damage has been tending towards masking durability.

I know several folks (myself included) were asking for this when Riot was hashing out the Marksmen update last year.  Having %Pen on items means resists have to be so high that Tanks are immortal to people without Whisper/Void and feel soft against people with Whisper/Void.  End result?  Someone is always going to feel bad.

If %Pen/Shred were an effect limited to champion kits only then Riot could balance the game around sane resist values.  That would also increase the value of spells like Kog's Q and Trundle's Ult against hard front lines.  As it stands right now *everyone* resist shreds.
Healing and Grievous Wounds are in a similar situation.
Let's hope they do this for the tank update, I mean if there is a time to do the work it is when they are remaking all tank items.

I don't agree with you entirely, but can somewhat agree with your idea. I do think Tanks need a counter through % Pen, but I think that Tanks should have other ways besides just Armor and Magic Resist to reduce damage dealt to them through items.

Riot could just put more emphasis on %HP damage, which honestly is a healthier mechanic all things considered.  %HP damage soft-counters HP stacking while %Pen hard-counters resist stacking.  %Pen is bad enough that when you're matched against a champ with both %Shred and cleaver you're better off building Tabi and then stacking the hell out of HP.

I personally find Black Cleaver to be the most unhealthy form of % Pen. It provides every physical damage dealer on your team with increased damage. That's STUPIDLY good and promotes all AD teams, especially when you compare it to the AP counterpart (abyssal). I find Last Whisper to be decently healthy, although the side effects might need to be changed slightly. Void Staff needs to be modernized if you know what I mean (Bonus Magic Pen not Base Magic Pen).

>Tanks will never be able to have individual power curves as long as %Pen items exist

That's not true at all.
What tanks need is a Class Update respectively. What they should get in the update is pronounced kits to differentiate them between each other because the tanks we have now (at least the meta tanks) do the same stuff almost entirely and the best tank for the job is the tank that stat checks out. Same issue Assassins had prior to their class update.

If you eliminate resistance penetration items, that would mean tanks could get "infinitely" tanky at one point, completely starting to shut down damage champions.

While tanks not being diverse is true (more or less, as there are definitely outliers), this post isn't really about that.

In ADC roles, there are early game ADCs, mid game ADCs, and late game ADCs. And mix of some too, of course.
But for tanks, such distinction is difficult to balance for because late game is when offense outscales defense. 6 item ADC will shred through 6 item tank, because %pen exists.
The game is balanced around that so it's not really that unhealthy. BUT, if we are to give tanks individual power curves (some early game tanks, some mid game tanks, some late game tanks), %penetration needs to change somehow.
Riot did say that tank itemization, along with % pen itemization, is going to get looked at at the same time as the as the Tank Update.
